ID.source description: Indicates the ID of the feature. IDs for each feature must be unique within the scope of the GFF file. In the case of discontinuous features (i.e. a single feature that exists over multiple genomic locations) the same ID may appear on multiple lines. All lines that share an ID collectively represent a single feature.

Name.source description: Display name for the feature. This is the name to be displayed to the user. Unlike IDs, there is no requirement that the Name be unique within the file.

Alias.source description: A secondary name for the feature. It is suggested that this tag be used whenever a secondary identifier for the feature is needed, such as locus names and accession numbers. Unlike ID, there is no requirement that Alias be unique within the file.

Parent.source description: Indicates the parent of the feature. A parent ID can be used to group exons into transcripts, transcripts into genes, an so forth. A feature may have multiple parents. Parent can only be used to indicate a partof relationship.
Parent.dev comment: EMBL isn't formatted with parent pointers, but some things like CDS have pointers back to their gene

Target.source description: Indicates the target of a nucleotide-to-nucleotide or protein-to-nucleotide alignment. The format of the value is "target_id start end [strand]", where strand is optional and may be "+" or "-". If the target_id contains spaces, they must be escaped as hex escape %20.
Target.dev comment: for now this is un-mapped in the final EMBL

Gap.source description: The alignment of the feature to the target if the two are not collinear (e.g. contain gaps). The alignment format is taken from the CIGAR format described in the Exonerate documentation.

Derives_from.source description: Used to disambiguate the relationship between one feature and another when the relationship is a temporal one rather than a purely structural "part of" one. This is needed for polycistronic genes.

Ontology_term.source description: A cross reference to an ontology term.

Is_circular.source description: A flag to indicate whether a feature is circular.

gene_name.source description: The source is a free text qualifier intended to describe the algorithm or operating procedure that generated this feature. Typically this is the name of a piece of software, such as "Genescan" or a database name, such as "Genbank." In effect, the source is used to extend the feature ontology by adding a qualifier to the type creating a new composite type that is a subclass of the type in the type column.
gene_name.dev comment: could possibly map to 'gene_synonym' as well.

geneID.dev comment: from comment in /standard_name docs: 'use /gene to give gene symbol'

description.dev comment: Hard to march more directly than to note sadly.

_Description.dev comment: Hard to march more directly than to note sadly.
